model

Class ModelAddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.ModelAddressBook

  • public final class ModelAddressBook
extends java.util.Observable
    Class representing an address book with contacts
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julien ADAM
    See Also:
    Observable

      • findContact

        public int findContact(ModelContact contact)
        looks for a contact in the address book according to the contact last name
        Parameters:
        contact - to find in address book
        Returns:
        if succeeded, the list indice where contact is stored in database. Otherwise, -1

      • updateContact

        public void updateContact(ModelContact contact)
        Update a contact in the address book. If the contact is not found in the base, he is added instead.
        Parameters:
        contact - : the contact to update

      • filterByGroup

        public void filterByGroup(java.lang.String group)
        Apply a filter in order to mark contact which have to be displayed according to the given group filter
        Parameters:
        group - : group used to filter contacts. If group is "ALL", all contacts will be kept.

      • filterByGroupInit

        public void filterByGroupInit()
        Re-initialization of group filter.

      • filterByContact

        public void filterByContact(java.lang.String id)
        Apply a filter in order to find the contact to display according to the id selected by the user
        Parameters:
        id - : a chain constituted by last and first name from the selected contact

      • filterByContactInit

        public void filterByContactInit()
        Re-initialization of contact filter

        : the number of contacts selected

        public boolean openHomePage(java.lang.String url)
        Open a web browser (if supported) and access to a specifing URL
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if browser opening succeeded. False otherwise.

        : True if mail client opening succeeded. False otherwise.
